wikipedia_page.main: Elizabeth "Eliza" Ann Ashurst Bardonneau (8 July 1813 – 25 November 1850) was a member of an important family of radical activists in mid-nineteenth-century England and the first translator of George Sand's work into English.  The family supported causes ranging from women's suffrage to Italian unification.
